docs.snippet: FROM the viewpoint of both the carriers and passengers, there could have been worse weekends than this Thanksgiving holiday for a major airline strike, but not much worse. Christmas and New Year holiday periods probably would have inconvenienced more...
docs.lead_paragraph: FROM the viewpoint of both the carriers and passengers, there could have been worse weekends than this Thanksgiving holiday for a major airline strike, but not much worse. Christmas and New Year holiday periods probably would have inconvenienced more people and have hurt resort areas more than last week's shutdown of Eastern and Trans World Airlines by strikes over wages and a jurisdictional dispute between Eastern's pilots and engineers unions.

headline.main: NEW FORCE RAISES VOICE IN URUGUAY; Benito Nardone, Leader of Farm Bloc, Emerges as a Nation-Wide Power

byline.original: By JUAN de ONISSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The elections in Uruguay on Sunday came up with a dramatic surprise. For the first time in ninety-three years the Blancos, or Nationals, have won a clear majority. The Colorados went down to a resounding defeat as a party, and their leader for...
docs.lead_paragraph: The elections in Uruguay on Sunday came up with a dramatic surprise. For the first time in ninety-three years the Blancos, or Nationals, have won a clear majority. The Colorados went down to a resounding defeat as a party, and their leader for thirteen years, who appeared to have an unbeatable political machine, Luis Batlle Berres, was repudiated.

docs.snippet: CHICAGO, Dec. 2 -- The Japanese Government signed a contract today for 10,000 square feet of exhibit space at the 1959 Chicago International Trade Fair. This made Japan the largest single exhibitor booked so far.
docs.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, Dec. 2 -- The Japanese Government signed a contract today for 10,000 square feet of exhibit space at the 1959 Chicago International Trade Fair. This made Japan the largest single exhibitor booked so far.
docs.abstract: Japan signs up for large exhibit space

headline.main: JAPAN GETS BIG AREA AT '59 CHICAGO FAIR

headline.main: Archbishop Albert Levame Dies at 77; Papal Nuncio to Ireland Since 1954

byline.original: SPecial to Tha New York Times

docs.snippet: The day after tomorrow France's new National Assembly -- the first to be elected under the Fifth Republic -- will convene. The Assembly represents a sharp swing to the right for France. In fact, it will be so heavily dominated by Rightists that many...
docs.lead_paragraph: The day after tomorrow France's new National Assembly -- the first to be elected under the Fifth Republic -- will convene. The Assembly represents a sharp swing to the right for France. In fact, it will be so heavily dominated by Rightists that many observers predict collisions between it and the man slated to become President of France -- Gen. Charles de Gaulle.
